messages.text: Hi, I was considering to update IntervalConstraintProgramming.jl to use the new major version of ModelingToolkit (<https://github.com/JuliaIntervals/IntervalConstraintProgramming.jl/issues/172>) -- because we updated LazySets the other day and now it's out of sync with other optional dependencies such as this one.

messages.text:
do you know how to update, eg.

```function make_constraint(expr::Operation, constraint, var=[])
    C = Contractor(var, expr)
    ex = expr ∈ constraint
    ConstraintSeparator(constraint, C, ex)
end```
i think it's `expr::Term`  but i'm not 100% sure if that covers all relevant cases

messages.text:
```julia> @variables x y
(x, y)

julia> ModelingToolkit.istree(x)
false

julia> ModelingToolkit.istree(x + y)
false

julia> ModelingToolkit.istree(x + y <= 1)
true```

elements.text:
julia> @variables x y
(x, y)

julia> ModelingToolkit.istree(x)
false

julia> ModelingToolkit.istree(x + y)
false

julia> ModelingToolkit.istree(x + y <= 1)
true

messages.text:
cannot the `@constraint` macro from `IntervalConstraintProgramming` handle numerical expressions such as `1/3` `sqrt(3)` and so on?
```
julia> c1 = @constraint x+y<3/2
ERROR: LoadError: TypeError: in Interval, in T, expected T<:Real, got Type{Expr}
Stacktrace:
 [1] ..(::Float64, ::Expr) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\IntervalArithmetic\odPjL\src\intervals\intervals.jl:144
 [2] parse_comparison(::Expr) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\IntervalConstraintProgramming\CQFKf\src\separator.jl:88
 [3] @constraint(::LineNumberNode, ::Module, ::Expr, ::Any) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\IntervalConstraintProgramming\CQFKf\src\separator.jl:185 (repeats 2 times)
in expression starting at REPL[4]:1

julia> c1 = @constraint x+y<sqrt(3)
ERROR: LoadError: TypeError: in Interval, in T, expected T<:Real, got Type{Expr}
Stacktrace:
 [1] ..(::Float64, ::Expr) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\IntervalArithmetic\odPjL\src\intervals\intervals.jl:144
 [2] parse_comparison(::Expr) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\IntervalConstraintProgramming\CQFKf\src\separator.jl:88
 [3] @constraint(::LineNumberNode, ::Module, ::Expr, ::Any) at C:\Users\lucaa\.julia\packages\IntervalConstraintProgramming\CQFKf\src\separator.jl:185 (repeats 2 times)
in expression starting at REPL[5]:1```

messages.text: in case you are interested, the methods in that text are in the TIRA toolbox (<https://arxiv.org/abs/1902.05204> )

attachments.title: TIRA: Toolbox for Interval Reachability Analysis
attachments.text: This paper presents TIRA, a Matlab library gathering several methods for the computation of interval over-approximations of the reachable sets for both continuous- and discrete-time nonlinear...
attachments.fallback: arXiv.org: TIRA: Toolbox for Interval Reachability Analysis

elements.text: in case you are interested, the methods in that text are in the TIRA toolbox (

messages.text: there's also a related tool called PIRK ( <https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7363203/> )

attachments.title: PIRK: Scalable Interval Reachability Analysis for High-Dimensional Nonlinear Systems
attachments.text: Reachability analysis is a critical tool for the formal verification of dynamical systems and the synthesis of controllers for them. Due to their computational complexity, many reachability analysis methods are restricted to systems with relatively small ...
